title: TGaceAllStories
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Suze Orman says retirees should have a 5-year ‘just-in-case’ fund. Is she right?
items.description: “I had people coming unglued on me when I suggested retirees should have three to five years of their savings in a money-market fund or CDs.”

items.title: Jensen Huang says Nvidia is missing out on a Boeing-sized opportunity in China: ‘Not a plane, the entire company.’
items.description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang made a not-very-subtle case for the Trump administration to review their China microchip restrictions.

items.title: My second wife says her 2 kids should inherit our estate, but I also have 2 kids. Is that fair?
items.description: “I will leave the $1 million inheritance I received from my parents to my biological daughters.”

items.title: Novo Nordisk shares are rising after the company cut its outlook. It’s been that kind of year.
items.description: Novo Nordisk is managing the unusual feat of seeing its stock price rise after reducing its earnings outlook.

items.title: Wednesday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
items.description: Stocks posted back-to-back declines on Tuesday, with the Dow Industrials sliding nearly 400 points. Here's what's on CNBC's radar heading into Wednesd...

items.title: This mouse and keyboard maker is a buy thanks to strong Generation Alpha gaming trends, UBS says
items.description: UBS pointed to rising gamification in Generation Alpha as a main catalyst driving Logitech going forward.

items.title: The economy is showing signs of weakening. Here’s what it means for investors hunting yield
items.description: Quality in the world of fixed income is back in focus as the U.S. economy begins to show some cracks.

items.title: Small investors rushed into Berkshire shares during dip even after their hero Buffett set exit
items.description: Everyday traders bought more than $24 million of Class B shares on Monday.
